column1: Every day in Congress I stand up for women across our district and country. Today I’m honored to stand beside them at the #OCWomensMarch https://t.co/7kJo2mPVdm

The US is the only industrialized nation in the world that doesn't have maternity leave. That's so wrong. This is why I'm fighting to protect our families and extend their paid leave.  Join me by signing this petition ⬇️ https://t.co/FhqRytxB0L

Like myself @MikeBloomberg believes in smart capitalism coupled with good government.  He’s a legendary businessman who also ran one of the nation’s largest and most complex cities.   Because of his unique experience and vision I’m proud to endorse Mike Bloomberg for President. https://t.co/UMTD4cR9B6

Orange County families should not be taxed twice on the same dollar. I’ve fought hard to repeal the SALT Tax a change that would save CA-48 residents $4000 annually as soon as next year.   How would you save/spend your hard earned dollars?https://t.co/IF0JFDqurS

It is in this spirit that I ran for the 48th Congressional District of California in 2017 and with that same commitment I ask for your continued support.  I hope you can join us this Saturday at our 2020 Re-Election Campaign Kickoff.  RSVP: https://t.co/CD0Qt4u1cO

Despite our successes the NRCC has identified our race as a top target putting party over the people of the 48th.  I believe in using common sense for common ground and being an accessible and unifying Congressional Representative for all constituents.

The President of the United States is supposed to represent freedom — of speech and religion. I condemn the president’s remarks and march toward totalitarianism and call on all my colleagues to do the same.

Singling out the Jewish community for lack of fealty to an individual is the calling card of anti-Semitic totalitarianism. We’ve seen this throughout history and now we see it repeated by the leader of the free world.

Trump continues to claim there’s an economic conspiracy against him but the data in our district paints a different picture. He needs to stop his trade war and work with Congress to make the economy work for all Americans. https://t.co/AeS4JH6PgW

I’m heartbroken and disgusted.  Thoughts and prayers from NRA apologists in Congress are insulting to victims. Their silence is deafening— It makes them permissive even complicit in this epidemic.  It’s time for a special session of Congress to make this mass shooting the last.

Today we mourn more deaths at the hand of the gun violence epidemic less than a week since deaths in California. Our hearts go out to the community in El Paso. As details continue to become available one thing remains true: the Senate must act on gun violence in our country.

If you’re a parent just try to imagine the kind of pain in Gilroy. It’s clear too many politicians have stopped trying.  The House sent two life saving reforms to the Senate Clerk’s desk. Senate leadership has shrugged at the deaths of children for too long—pass the damn bills.

I’ve called out Dems for tropes they’ve used too. Speaking out only against the other party doesn’t require a whole lot of courage or principles—and it’s time for GOP elected leaders to speak against Trump’s dangerous words.   Wrong is wrong no matter what side it comes from.
